nz.govt.natlib.meta
Class TransformProcessor

java.lang.Object
  nz.govt.natlib.meta.TransformProcessor
Direct Known Subclasses:
DoNothingTransformer, XSLTransformer
public abstract class TransformProcessor
extends java.lang.Object

This is really just an adapter - you might say! But, it is slightly simpler and different and rationalising it would be twisting it into something it isn't. This class is also a factory, that produces Transformers by name or function.

Version:
1.0
Author:
unascribed

Method Detail

getInstance

public static TransformProcessor getInstance(java.lang.String inDTD,
                                             java.lang.String outDTD)
This returns a TransformProcessor that is capable of transforming an XML document from one DTD to the other. At the moment it uses the config 'Map' to decide how to transform something. This method could be smarter and determine that if it couldn't directly get from one format to another, it would take a multistep approach... Too cool to build for this project.

Parameters:
inDTD -
outDTD -

getInstance

public static TransformProcessor getInstance(java.lang.String xsl)

transform

public abstract void transform(java.io.InputStream in,
                               java.io.OutputStream out)
transforms one xml file into another using the xsl style sheet specified. This is the streaming way of doing it - which would be the best way for large scale uses of this tool.

transform

public byte[] transform(byte[] buffer)
transforms one xml file into another using the xsl style sheet specified. This is the 'in-memory' way of doing it - best for transforming data that is already in memory. This is a less efficient way of doing this and should only be used where a stream based method would be impossible.
